title: A single holiday was the turning point of the COVID-19 policy of Israel
body:
We analyzed epidemiological investigation reports during the first month of 49 the outbreak in Israel. In addition, we present a deterministic compartment model and 50 simulations of several scenarios emphasizing quarantine and isolation policies given 51 their efficiency. 52

We identify an abrupt change from controlled epidemic regime to an 54 exponential growth (ܴ ൌ 2.19) in light of the actual policy-makers decisions and 55 public behavior in Israel. Our analysis show that before the abrupt change, the new 56 cases trend was due to returning citizens infected abroad. The abrupt change followed 57 a holiday in which social distancing was clearly inefficient and many public 58 gatherings were held. We further discuss three different modeled scenarios of 59 quarantine efficiency: high-, medium-, and low-efficiency. 60

Even before the onset of the pandemic in Israel, fine-63 tuned but determined early decisions were taken by policy makers to monitor flight 64 arrivals from Covid-19 affected regions and to limit public gatherings.
